page.title: 05A COLLIERY-WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: {Babbington,}situated at Cinderhill is one of the oldest working pits in existence.It was sunk in 1841 by {Thomas North}who was a pioneer in mining technology.It was the first pit to have{Tandem headgear,}powerful winding engines, iron tubing in shafts to prevent water seepage, iron winding ropes, cages, underground mechanical haulages, furnace ventilation, underground gas lighting and the {Longwall system of mining.}Although furnaces and gas have been taken over by electricity, the original shafts, known as Windy and Smokey are still in regular use. Windy sucked down air and Smokey acted as a chimney.Over a century of spoil has been deposited to the North of the pit covering over 29,000 sq.metres. This is being landscaped as the pit is nearing the end of its working life.
